Biography

9 Mar 1808, Lewis Berkely to Miss Elizabeth Darracott, both of Hanover (RE, 29 Mar 1808, pg 3)

DIED: Mr. Lewis Berkley age 59 at his residence, Mountout, 12 May 1836 (RE, 20 May 1836, pg 3) - gravestone says he died 12 May 1836

Lewis Berkeley's Gravestone: Died 12 May 1836, aged 61 years.

WILL

[Hanover Co., Virginia Wills & Notes]

WILL OF LEWIS BERKLEY - dated: 22 Feb 1836 & probated 28 June 1836

Wife: Elizabeth 1/3 of my estate including the Mountout house, furniture, my carraige & horses and after her death I give the same to my children.

DAU: Susan Berkeley, shall not have a $200 legacy as my other children because I think she has an equivalent in the provision of Sally Marshall. I have advanced to my daughter Susan and son-in-law, Edmund Berkley $1,000 which they are to account for before sharing in my estate.

DAU: Mary N. and her husband Richard F. Darracott I have advanced $400 and they to account for it.

ALL my children, except Susan shall have $200 and all my children to share in my estate.

CHILDREN: Nelson, William, Landon C., Richard F., Francis E., Lewis & Lucy C. I appoint my wife Elizabeth, my son Nelson W., my son-in-law (s) Richard F, Darracott & Edmund Berkley, exors.

Witt: Nelson Berkley, Jr, Benjamin X Vaughn, William G. King, J.W. Shepard.

Further data from this lawsuit: in 1856 Richard F. Darracott had a wife Betty S; Susan E. w/o Edmund Berkley; Mary N. stated she was 46 & h/h Richard F Darracott was 49;

Lucy C., was aged 30 and w/o James B. Shelton aged 31.

"Some of these children have conveyed their interest in the Lewis Berkeley estate to George J Herring & wife Mary P. Herring, John Darracott of Richmond & William D. Winston of Hanover"

Lewis was born in 1775. He was the son of Nelson Berkeley and Elizabeth Carter. He passed away in 1836.

Sources
